---
title: GHQ-12 vs GHQ-30
---

## GHQ-12 vs GHQ-30: A Comparative Analysis Using Harmony

The process of comparing and harmonising questionnaire items such as those in GHQ-12 and GHQ-30 can be a grueling one for psychologists and social scientists. Thanks to the advances in natural language processing and generative AI models, it's now made easy by the innovative software called Harmony. Whether in the same or different languages, GHQ-12 vs GHQ-30 comparison and harmonisation can be streamlined and made more objective using Harmony.


## Compare the items in GHQ-12 English and GHQ-30

The General Health Questionnaire (GHQ) is a widely utilised measure for detecting psychological distress. That being said, the different versions (GHQ-12 and GHQ-30) often require harmonisation for accurate cross-study analysis.


{{< image src="images/gad7-becks.jpg" alt="dog" title="dog" >}}

{{< card heading="Try Harmony" copy="Compare GHQ-12 and GHQ-30 " url="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app" >}}

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}




Harmony takes this time-consuming process off your shoulders in a user-friendly manner. For example, you can easily upload your GHQ-12 or GHQ-30 document directly into Harmony's web interface and swiftly receive a percentage match between the items in the two questionnaires. The use of Harmony in attempting the GHQ-12 vs GHQ-30 comparative analysis is highly recommended. The distinction between items in the GHQ-12 and GHQ-30 is crucial in understanding the impact and extent of psychological distress amongst the respondents. Without accurate harmonisation, the validity of the findings may be compromised. In this regard, Harmony provides reliable and technologically advanced assistance to ensure your GHQ-12 vs GHQ-30 comparison and harmonisation is both accurate and efficient.
